titles.title: Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness Act of 2011
A bill to provide for the adjustment of status of certain nationals of Liberia to that of lawful permanent residents.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 3/28/2011--Introduced. Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness Act of 2011 - Adjusts to permanent resident status a qualifying Liberian national who: (1) has been continuously present in the United States between January 1, 2011, through the date of status adjustment application; or (2) is the spouse, child, or unmarried son or daughter of such an alien. Requires adjustment applications to be filed not later than one year after the date of enactment of this Act.
